title: Avoid exception and console error message when SKCanvasView is created and then immediately disposed in Blazor
body:
**Description of Change**

<!-- Describe your changes here. -->
In JavaScript methods, return early when the target element is no longer present in the DOM, and remove the related error log for this scenario.

In Blazor, elements can be removed from the DOM before a component’s Dispose() method is invoked. This means that after any async call, the corresponding DOM element may already have been removed due to navigation. There’s no reliable way to distinguish whether a missing element is due to normal component disposal or an actual logic error. This change updates the code to simply stop execution when the element is absent and suppress error logging for this case.

Ref: https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/issues/45777

**Bugs Fixed**

- Fixes #

<!-- Provide links to issues here. Ensure that a GitHub issue was created for your feature or bug fix before sending PR. -->
https://github.com/mono/skiasharp/issues/3322

**API Changes**

None.

**Behavioral Changes**

None.

<!-- Describe any non-bug related behavioral changes that may change how users app behaves when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None.
